LanguageData.WVC_XaG_CollapseButtonDesc: Allows to toggle the size of the displayed window, making it smaller or larger.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_SimpleGestatorDesc: Begins the gestation process, upon completion of which it will spawn a newborn pawn with a copy of all the parent's genes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_SimpleGestator_ToYoungMessa: {0} is not in the reproductive stage.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_SimpleGestatorFailMessage: It is impossible to start a pregnancy.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_SimpleGestatorWarning: After activating the ability, gestation will begin, which will impose a moving and manipulation debuff, and also increase hunger. The process cannot be interrupted.\n\nDo you still need a new pawn?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_ParthenogenesisWarning: After using the ability, the pawn will become pregnant. The child will receive all of the mother's germline genes, including archites. The process can be interrupted in the same ways as a normal pregnancy.\n\nDo you still need a new pawn?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_ParthenogenesisDesc: Conceive a child without a partner.
LanguageData.WVC_RB_Gene_GolemGestator: {0}'s mechanoid has finished the gestation process.
LanguageData.WVC_RB_Gene_Summoner: The package is already on its way!
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MechanoidSummon_Letter: A {0} has dropped from orbit and is placing itself under the control of {1_nameDef}.
LanguageData.WVC_PawnIsAndroidCheck: User and target must be humans and genetically compatible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_WrongDevelopmentalStage: The target has an inappropriate developmental stage.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ThrallMakerNonThrallSelected: First you need to choose the type of thrall.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ScenPart_NullifyBackstory: The backstory of the starting pawns is unknown.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ScenPart_NullifySkills: All starting pawns' skills will be 0 and without passions.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ScenPart_StartingMutations: Starting pawns will have {0} random mutations.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_OverOverrideGene: <color=#ff8585>This gene always overrides genes with which it is mutually exclusive.</color>
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GenesSettings_DescTip: <color=#f5ffa2>Tip:</color> Use the <color=#8a8ae6>genes settings</color> gizmo to control the gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Message_EyesColor_Error: The pawn does not have the gene for recoloring eyes.
LanguageData.WVC_AbilityValidation_ReimplantationChec: Reimplantation in progress. Wait for the process to finish before starting another one.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_General_DisabledIdeo: {PAWN_nameDef}'s ideology prevents {PAWN_objective} from using this ability.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AddedDeathRefusalAttempt: {0} received a death refusal from the {1} gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MessageWrongRottingStage: The target has an inappropriate rotting stage.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ErrorMessage: Not possible in the current state.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_PawnIsQuestLodgerMessage: {0} must belong to the player's faction.
LanguageData.WVC_OrderToRepairDesc: Give the order to one of the controlled mechanoids to repair the mechanitor.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_HemogenicMetabolism_LowHemogen: Hemogen level too low. Conversion of hemogen into nutrients is no longer possible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_OverriderDesc: Allows to change the bonus from overrided genes, changing it between positive or negative values.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_OverriderDependantDesc: <color=#ffec85>This gene is not mutually exclusive with similar genes.</color>
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogBiosculpterPod_ChanceDesc: The estimated chance of success in implanting this xenotype. The higher the chance, the more genes the pawn can receive. This calculation does not include the genes of the potential occupier.\n\n<color=#f5ffa2>Current chance</color>: {0}
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenotypeHolderCycleStarted_Xenot: The selected xenotype is not available.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenotypeHolderCycleStarted_Dialo: Once the cycle starts, it will be impossible to select another xenotype, are you sure?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenotypeHolderCycleStarted_Selec: Allows to select a xenotype for the xenosculptor cycle. The xenotype that can be selected is determined relative to the genebanks located in the same room with the biosculptor. It is recommended to select a xenotype before starting the cycle, otherwise the pawn's xenotype will be reset to the baseliner.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneNaturalMechlinkLetterDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} has been feeling strange for a long time, {PAWN_pronoun} feels the psychic presence of the mechanoids more clearly every day. And now {PAWN_possessive} overseer potential has been fully realized, {PAWN_pronoun} has formed a mechlink.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneNaturalPsylinkLetterDesc: {PAWN_nameDef} has been feeling strange for a long time, {PAWN_possessive} sense of the world has become clearer every day. And now {PAWN_possessive} psychic potential has been fully revealed, {PAWN_pronoun} has formed a psylink.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ColorableEyesDesc: Eye color can be changed at any time.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ResetEyesColorWarning: The pawn does not have a default eye color.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AdministerXenogermWarningDesc: Depending on the type of serum, its use may put {PAWN_nameDef} in a coma as the xenogerm integrates itself. On average, this lasts for {COMADURATION}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SuremRetuneJob_Desc: You can change the xenotype that the serum is tuned to.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SuremRetuneJob_ChangeDesc: You have chosen the {0} xenotype. Are you sure of your choice?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SerumCustomMode_Desc: Allows to switch between standard and custom mode. Custom xenotypes are always randomized.
LanguageData.WVC_ImplantXenogermSerumDesc: Administer the serum for the selected pawn.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGiverImplanted_Desc: {0} received the "{1}" gene, due to this {0}'s genes will be regrowing.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_GeneticInstabilityDesc: Pawn will automatically try to use the stabilizer when there are less than 3 days left until the next instabilization.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_LetterTextThrallIImplanted: {TARGET_nameDef} was resurrected and transformed. {TARGET_pronoun} received a hybrid germline that combined a number of special genes, old {TARGET_nameDef} genes and some {CASTER_nameDef} genes.
LanguageData.WVC_ForceXenogermImplantationDesc: Force this person to implant their genes into another individual using a special injector organ. If this person's genes are currently regrowing, they will die in the process.\n\nWhen implanted, the new genes will overwrite the target genes according to the type of the implanter gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ReimplantResurrectionRecruiting_: {PAWN_nameDef} belongs to {1} faction, and even if resurrected, it will not join your settlement.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_NewBack_GeneIsFurskin_CanBeDisab: Graphics can be disabled in the settings.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_OverrideExistingGenes_De: Does this sub-xenotype overwrite existing genes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_IgnoreExistingGenes_Desc: Does this sub-xenotype add its own genes to the existing ones.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_RemovedGenes_Desc: These genes will be removed from the gene set if present.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_RandomGenes_Desc: Some of these genes can be added to a gene set.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_SubXenotypes_CanEvolveOn: Can this xenotype evolve into another xenotype if it dies.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_SubXenotypes_CanEvolveOv: Can this xenotype evolve into another xenotype over time.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_EvolveChance_Desc: The chance with which this xenotype evolves when special conditions are met.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SubXeno_SubXenotypesList_Desc: Xenotypes into which this xenotype can evolve.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneThrallMaker_ButtonDesc: Opens a menu where you can select the germline and mutation for the implanter.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DevXenotypeDef_XenotypeDesc: A unique variation of super xenohuman that resulted from the hybridization of {0} and {1} xenotypes. This one has half the genetic diversity of both xenotypes, combining both strengths and weaknesses.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterTextGenesImplanted: {TARGET_nameDef} will be in a xenogermination coma for the next {COMADURATION} while {TARGET_possessive} body adjusts to the changes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Extreme_GeneticInstabilityMessag: Due to genetic instability, {0} lost consciousness.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RegenerationSleepGizmoTip: Pawn can be put into <color=#6bb6bb>regeneration coma</color> at any time, but it will take an hour to come out of it. When falling into a coma, the pawn receives all the same effects as when falling into it from the <color=#6bb6bb>deathless</color> gene. It will last either until <color=#8a8ae6>full recovery</color>, or end when <color=#8a8ae6>time expires</color>.\n\nYou can also <color=#8a8ae6>extend</color> the pawn's coma. The coma is always <color=#8a8ae6>extended</color> for an additional 6 days.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RegenerationSleepAddHediffTip: Put the pawn into regeneration coma or extend it for 6 days.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RegenerationSleepRemoveHediffTip: Reset the coma to an hour.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterTextSecondChance_GeneUndead:
Thanks to the {1} gene, {PAWN_nameDef} returns to the world of the living.
It will take {PAWN_objective} some time to recover, but if {PAWN_pronoun} dies again, it will most likely be permanent.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterTextSecondChance_GeneUndeadSha:
Thanks to the {1} gene, {PAWN_nameDef} returns to the world of the living. However, this caused a side effect. {PAWN_nameDef}'s genes have been changed and {PAWN_possessive} xenotype is now {2}.
It will take {PAWN_objective} some time to recover, but if {PAWN_pronoun} dies again, it will most likely be permanent.
LanguageData.WVC_LetterText_GeneRiseFromTheDead: {TARGET_nameDef} was resurrected, but this left a mark on {TARGET_objective}, now {TARGET_nameDef} is completely different.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AbilityDisabledNoResurgent: {0_labelShort} does not have enough resurgent cells.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AbilityGeneIsActive_PawnBaseline: Pawn must not have this ability.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AbilityGeneIsActive_PawnNotHaveG: Pawn does not have the required genes or it is not active
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AutoBaseDesc: Determines whether the gene will be triggered automatically.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MechanitorShouldBeLich: The user must be a mechanitor and have the "Spore mechlink" gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneBabyTree_desc: If enabled, the baby will be spawned at the end of the countdown.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_WingsDesc: Allows to switch between walking and flying.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_CanResu: Responsible for whether the pawn can be auto-resurrected after death. If the body deteriorates or rots, then resurrection will be impossible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_AlwaysR: The only way to kill is to destroy the body.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_CanRein: Responsible for whether the descendant of the pawn will appear in case of death. The minimum chronological age must be greater than {0} years.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DisplayStats_Undead_CanShap: Responsible for whether the pawn's genes will change after auto-resurrection. This is influenced by the set of genes and xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_DustMechlinkDesc: Allows to toggle the automatic mechs summoning. Mechanoids summoned in this way land in drop pods at a random cell on the map.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Sporelink_ConnectWithResurg: Affects whether resurgent trees will react to the psionic presence of the gene carrier. Resurgent trees only animate golems if they can find at least one psionic presence.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_EternalHunger_HuntWarning: {0} is going to bite one of the colonists!
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_HemogenicMetabolismDesc: If enabled, it replenishes the hunger bar, but significantly increases the hemogen consumption. If the bar reaches its maximum or the hemogen drops too low, the effect will automatically turn off.
LanguageData.WVC_FeedDownedBloodeaterForcedDesc: If the bloodeater is unable to eat on its own, you can feed it manually.
LanguageData.WVC_StatsReport_RechargerGeneClass_Desc: Genes with which xenohumans can use this recharger. The following genes are compatible
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_InvisibilityDesc: Allows to turn invisibility on and off.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GolemBandwidthGizmoTip: A mechanitor can oversee as many <color=#8a8ae6>golems</color> as <color=#8a8ae6>mechanoids</color>, but creating <color=#8a8ae6>new</color> ones requires a <color=#8a8ae6>golembond</color>. Each <color=#8a8ae6>golem</color> consumes a different amount of <color=#8a8ae6>golembond</color>.\n\nGain more golembond with help of <color=#6bb6bb>genes</color>.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGolemlinkSummonSettings_Desc: Opens a menu where you can configure which golems will be animated by archites. Does not affect summoning.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GolemnoidsGeneralDesc: In general golemnoids are dense clusters of archites animating a pile of “something”, they, like mechanoids, require mechlink and bandwidth for control, in addition to this they require golembond. Golems lose energy much faster than mechs, but very quickly restore the lost charge in shutdown mode.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeGolemCaste_NonChunk_NonGol: Not enough golembond or no available chunks in range.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeGolemCasteDescFull: Give the golem the order to change type. The golem will try to find a free chunk, and then the archites will move from the old body to the new one. In the process, this golem will be converted into a chunk. The new golem will not inherit anything from the old one.\n\nDo you wish to continue?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeGolemModeDesc: Archites in a golem can be ordered to change their golem type. This requires a free chunk and enough golembond.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GolemCreatedFromRandomChunk_Mess: Archites animated the chunk, the new golem is called {0}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_GolemlinkGizmoSpawnDesc: Allows to toggle the automatic creation of new golems. New golems will be created from stone chunks scattered on the map, if there are no chunks, then the golems will be summoned. Golems summoned in this way land in drop pods at a random cell on the map.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Golemlink_On_Info: Next golems animated or summoned in
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_BroodmindLimitGizmoTip:
The dryad master can partially control an unlimited number of dryads, but dryadbond is required to gestate new ones.

Each dryad, regardless of type, consumes 1 dryadbond. Gain more dryadbond by connecting with <color=#f76d6b>gauranlen trees</color> or with help of <color=#6bb6bb>genes</color>.

The level of connection with <color=#f76d6b>gauranlen trees</color> does not affect the bonus.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_GauranlenConnection_SpawnOn: Allows to enable or disable the gestation of new dryads.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChooseDryadCasteModeInitialDesc: Here you can choose a caste for the {0}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChangeDreadCasteDescFull: It will take several days for the dryad to change caste, during which time the dryad will be immobilized and defenseless.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DryadQueenSelectAllDryads_Desc: Select all dryads associated with the queen.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneDryadsSelectDryadQueen_Desc: Select dryad queen to whom this dryad belongs.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_Desc: Here you can select the genes collected by the pawn and implant them.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_ImplantGeneSet:
The selected genes will be implanted as xenogenes, and the pawn will receive genes regrowing hediff. Genes regrowing may limit the use of certain genes or abilities.

If the chimera gene is xenogene, then it will lose all accumulated genes and become endogene.

If the pawn already has genes regrowing, then all xenogene abilities will have a cooldown after implantation.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_ClearGeneSet: All xenogenes will be removed, and the chimera gene, if it was a xenogene, will lose all accumulated genes and become endogene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_EatSelectedGene: When eaten, genes become inaccessible. They can no longer be re-obtained or implanted, but this can have benefits in some cases.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_ConflictingGene: Some of the selected genes are mutually exclusive.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGeneticThief_GenesHarvested: {0}'s genes were harvested, {0}'s xenotype was reset to the baseliner.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_WarningPawnWillDieFromHarvesting: Warning: {PAWN_nameDef}'s genes are currently regrowing. If {PAWN_pronoun} will be harvested before {PAWN_possessive} genes are fully regrown, it will kill {PAWN_objective}.\n\nAre you sure you wish to continue?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_CreateChimera_PresetsNameMessage: The preset must have a name.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Dialog_ChimeraPresetsList_Load: The selected preset will replace the selected genes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_HybridImplanterFail: The implanter was unable to create a hybrid geneset. The target and caster's genetic metabolisms are incompatible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_HybridImplanter_Warning: Warning! After using the ability, half of the caster's genes will be lost. These genes are randomly selected relative to all the caster's genes and their number. This will also lead to the reimplantation of the current genes, which will lead to their reset.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_StorageImplanter_Warning:
If a pawn has a storage implanter gene, then the selected genes/geneset/xenotype can be written into it and then implanted using the appropriate implanter ability.

If the storage implanter already contains gene information, it will be overwritten.

Note that in some cases the selected genes will be extracted from the source and cannot be returned. For example, the chimera will lose these genes if they were stored in it.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_StorageImplanter_Message: The genetic information has been successfully saved.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_StorageImplanter_NonValidMessage: Storage implanter is empty or missing. Use any gene that can preserve the geneset.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneChimeraReqGene: Entityty study is not complete or the pawn does not have the chimera gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneChimeraDevourFleshmassNucleu: Devour will destroy the fleshmass nucleus and completely transform the chimera. The pawn will lose some old endogenes and gain a number of new ones related to the fleshmass. The lost endogenes will be copied by the chimera gene and can be re-implanted later. These changes are irreversible and have some hidden dangers.\n\nAre you sure you wish to continue?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneChimeraDevourNociosphereWarn: Devour will destroy the nociosphere and completely transform the chimera. The pawn will lose some old endogenes and gain a number of new ones. The lost endogenes will be copied by the chimera gene and can be re-implanted later. These changes are irreversible and have some hidden dangers.\n\nAre you sure you wish to continue?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Voidlink_GizmoTip:
<color=#8a8ae6>Voidlink</color> allows to skip any <color=#8a8ae6>mechs</color> using a special resource called <color=#80b5e1>voidsence</color>. This resource is replenished gradually on its own. The cost of skipping <color=#8a8ae6>mechs</color> depends on their class and purpose. All skipped mechanoids can <color=#8a8ae6>self-repair</color>, and after death they skip back.

Skipping can provoke the appearance of an <color=#8a8ae6>nociosphere</color>, which will instantly attack. The more <color=#8a8ae6>mechs</color> under mechanitor control, the higher the chance of triggering a <color=#8a8ae6>nociosphere</color>. Each <color=#8a8ae6>mech</color> above {0} increases the chance by 1%, up to 50%.

 - Controlled mechs {1}/{0}
 - Nociosphere chance {2}%

<color=#ff8585>Note that all mechs under the pawn's control are taken into account.</color>
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_VoidlinkKillAllVoidMechs: Return mechs to the void. By doing this, <color=#80b5e1>voidsence</color> will be restored relative to the number of mechs.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_VoidlinkKillVoidMechDesc: Return this mechanoid to where it was skipped. This action will return 25% of the <color=#80b5e1>voidsence</color> spent on its skipping.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_VoidlinkKillAllVoidMechsWar: Returns all skipped mechanoids back and refunds part of the <color=#80b5e1>voidsence</color> spent on their skips. Mechs obtained in other ways, without the help of voidlink, are ignored.\n\nContinue?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_VoidlinkSummonSettings_Desc: Opens a menu where you can select mechs to skip.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Voidlink_CannotSummon: Not enough resource or space for skipping.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Gene_Voidlink_NociospherePresenc: Skipping is not possible due to the presence of nociosphere.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogVoidlink_VoidEnergyDesc: Cost of skipping this mechanoid. If the cost exceeds the current <color=#80b5e1>voidsence</color> level, the skip will be cancelled.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_CustomLabeledMechlinkDesc: A neural formation resulting from genetic evolution or modification, similar to what can be obtained by implanting a mechlink.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChosenLichDesc: Allows to select the mechanitor to whom the new golem will be assigned.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ChosenWalkerDesc: Allows to select the type of walker that will spawn the tree.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_AlwaysRandomizeDesc: If enabled, after each spawn, the mechanitor and the next spawn are randomized.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenoTreeBirthDesc: {0} has completed the gestation process. The selected xenotype can be re-selected.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenoTreeXenotypeChooseDesc: Allows to select the xenotype of the future baby.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_XenoTreeXenotypeChooseDisabled_O: First you need to choose a xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_Desc: You can choose any xenotype for gestation. Gestation time directly depends on the complexity of the xenotype and the gestation period of the gene carrier.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestationGenesM: The minimum matched genes must be at least {0}%
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestationGenesS: This person can gestate any xenotype due to its genetic characteristics.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestationWarnin: The gestation process will take time. During this time, the pawn will experience severe hunger and increased fatigue.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneXenoGestator_GestatorIsOnLet: {TARGET_nameDef} has started the gestation process, it will take some time. During this period, {TARGET_nameDef} will receive a number of debuffs.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneGestator_ComplitionDesc: {0} has completed the gestation process. The gestator will not be available for some time. The gestation process can be restarted later, after the post gestation period and the gestator cooldown have ended.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_Desc: Opens a menu in which you can select any xenotype available in the game. The exceptions are androids and custom xenotypes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_DisabledGenesRe: This person's genetic material is regrowing.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_MinMatchPercent: The genetic match to the selected xenotype is too low. Minimum match should be {0}%.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ShapeshifterDialog_XenotypeGenes: Expected number of xenotype genes. This does not reflect the exact number of genes in the xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneticMaterial_GenesDesc: The total genetic material of all selected genes. For implantation, it should not exceed the genetic material collected by shapeshifter.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneticMaterial_ShifterDesc: Genetic material collected by the shapeshifter gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogEditShiftGenes_PawnHasGene: The pawn already has one of the selected genes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogEditShiftGenes_Explanation: Genes can be implanted at the cost of genetic material. Implanted genes remove genes with which they conflict.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogEditShiftGenes_ConflictWit: The implantation will remove some of the pawn's genes.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogEditShiftGenes_Warning: Shapeshifter cannot remove genes individually. Implanted genes cannot be removed until the next shapeshift.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogEditShiftGenes_ChangeTypeW: This action will change the type of shapeshifter gene, if it was xenogene (xenogerm), it will become endogene (germline) and vice versa. The accumulated genetic material will be transferred.\n\nNote that genes implanted at the cost of genetic material are always implanted where the shapeshifter gene is located.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_DialogEditShiftGenes_ChangeTypeM: Shapeshifter changed it's genetic type successfully.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ShapeshifterDialog_TrueFormDesc: This xenotype is one of the natural forms of the shapeshifter. It can be implanted regardless of the owner's genetic condition.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneRemover_Desc: Allows to remove any genes from the current geneset. Genes are removed one at a time.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneRemover_Warning: This action will result in the gene being removed from the pawn's geneset, which is irreversible. If the shapeshifter gene is present, this may provide genetic material or, on the contrary, consume it. The amount of genetic material is calculated relative to the complexity and archites of the gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ShapeshifterGizmoTip:
<color=#8a8ae6>Shapeshifter</color> allows to change the pawn's xenotype at any time, this is limited only by the <color=#6bb6bb>genes regrowing</color> hediff. After <color=#8a8ae6>shapeshifting</color>, the pawn is guaranteed to receive <color=#6bb6bb>genes regrowing</color>, the duration of which depends on the complexity, metabolism and archites of the selected xenotype. If the pawn had <color=#6bb6bb>genes regrowing</color> at the time of shapeshifting, it is summed up.

Some xenotypes are <color=#8a8ae6>true forms</color>, these xenotypes can be applied at any time without restrictions.

 - <color=#8076ff>Genetic material</color>: {0}
 - <color=#6bb6bb>Genes regrowing</color>: {1}
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ShapeshifterGenesImplant_Desc:
Allows the implantation of special genes using excess <color=#8076ff>genetic material</color>.

<color=#8076ff>Genetic material</color> accumulates when using shapeshift, each xenotype has its own amount of accumulated material, except for <color=#8a8ae6>true forms</color>, they always have a zero value.

Also, the accumulation of <color=#8076ff>genetic material</color> is impossible if the genes regrowing effect was turned off for the gene.

Some sub-genes can also accumulate it.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifterStyles_Desc: Opens the ideology style menu. Which allows to change the appearance of the pawn. (req Ideology DLC)
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_NotPreferredXen: Xenotype does not correspond to beliefs.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_CheckBox_Implan: Some xenogene xenotypes are related to endogene xenotypes. If a xenogene xenotype has a double xenotype, then the shapeshifter can implant the genes of that xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_CheckBox_ClearX: If enabled, xenogens will be removed when implanting an endogene xenotype. For xenogene xenotypes, xenogenes will be removed regardless of this option.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_XenogermComaAft: Does a pawn fall into a xenogermination coma after a shapeshift. This can be changed with a special serum or under certain conditions.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_GenesRegrowAfte: Will pawn genes be regrow after shapeshift. This can be changed with a special serum or under certain conditions.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_ShapeshiftWarni: The pawn's xenotype will be changed to the selected xenotype, and the pawn will lose the genes of the previous xenotype and receive new ones. The shapeshifter gene will not be removed regardless of the selected xenotype.\n\nAfter implantation of new genes, the pawn receives xenogermination coma and genes regrowing.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneShapeshifter_ShapeshiftLette: {TARGET_nameDef}'s genes have been changed, {TARGET_possessive} xenotype is now {1}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_CellularDestroyBodyDesc: Extract archotechnology shard. Extracting the shard will kill the carrier and nullify its xenotype.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Skillshifter_Desc: Allows to redistribute experience in skills.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Skillshifter_Warning: There are {0} unallocated skill points left. After closing the window, all unallocated skill points will be irretrievably lost.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Traitshifter_Desc: Allows to change the traits of a pawn by removing them or adding new ones, up to a limit of 3 traits.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Traitshifter_Warning: This action will add/remove the selected trait.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Traitshifter_ConflictingTraits: The selected traits conflict with each other.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Traitshifter_MaxTraitsDesc: The maximum number of traits a pawn can have.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Traitshifter_SelectedTraitsDesc: Number of traits currently selected. Excluding gene traits, forced and unobtainable.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_Traitshifter_LockedTrait: This trait is either a gene or quest trait and cannot be removed or added.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneMorpherMenu_Desc: Opens a menu where you can view the morpher's saved genesets. Genesets cannot be edited or deleted in this menu.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneMorpherChangeTriggerGene_Des: Change the trigger gene to any of your choice. You will need archite capsules to change it. The trigger changes only for the current form.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneMorpherChangeTriggerGene_Fai: There is no suitable stack of archite capsules within reach.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MorpherGizmoTip: <color=#8a8ae6>Morpher</color> allows a pawn to change its <color=#6bb6bb>geneset</color> under certain conditions, determined by <color=#8a8ae6>trigger genes</color>, each such <color=#6bb6bb>geneset</color> is called a <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>. <color=#8a8ae6>Forms</color> are independent of each other and their <color=#8a8ae6>genes</color> can be modified without risk of harming another <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>.\n\n<color=#8a8ae6>Trigger genes</color> can be changed at any time, but this requires an <color=#6bb6bb>archite capsule</color>. Some <color=#8a8ae6>trigger genes</color> cannot be obtained this way.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_ArchiverGizmoTip:
<color=#8a8ae6>Archiver</color> allows a pawn to change itself completely under certain conditions determined by <color=#8a8ae6>trigger genes</color>, each such <color=#b0bf80>version</color> is called a <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>. <color=#8a8ae6>Forms</color> are independent of each other and each such <color=#8a8ae6>form</color> can change genes, clothes, implants, etc. without fear of harming other <color=#8a8ae6>forms</color>. However, if this gene is removed, all <color=#8a8ae6>forms</color> will be destroyed.

If there are no saved <color=#8a8ae6>forms</color>, then a <color=#b0bf80>duplicate</color> pawn is created, which inherits all genes, traits and backstory. Clothes and implants are not inherited in this way.

<color=#8a8ae6>Trigger genes</color> can be changed at any time, but this requires an <color=#6bb6bb>archite capsule</color>.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneAbilityMorphDesc: Morphing to another form. The form can be selected either from the list of available ones or a new one can be created.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneAbilityMorphUndeadResurrecti: Try to morph after undead resurrection. The new form is selected randomly.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneAbilityMorphWarning:
The <color=#8a8ae6>morph</color> will lead to a complete replacement of the current <color=#8a8ae6>geneset</color>. Also, the next <color=#8a8ae6>form</color> will be limited in accordance with the new <color=#8a8ae6>gene trigger</color>, keep in mind that the <color=#8a8ae6>trigger conditions</color> may be different.

The pawn will <color=#ff8585>lose all</color> connections created by the genes. Dryad queen will lose all dryads, and psychic bond its bond, etc.

Do you still want to change the <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneAbilityMorphWarning_Archiver:
<color=#8a8ae6>Morphing</color> will completely <color=#8a8ae6>rewrite</color> the pawn. Genes, traits, apparels, weapons, implants, thoughts, etc. almost everything will be unique to the new <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>. The new <color=#8a8ae6>form</color> is another version of the current pawn, not just a <color=#8a8ae6>geneset</color>. <color=#8a8ae6>Forms</color> share only some needs and ideology.

The current <color=#8a8ae6>form</color> (pawn) will be saved and can be returned to later.

The <color=#8a8ae6>morph</color> conditions and xenotype may also differ from the current one.

Do you still want to change the <color=#8a8ae6>form</color>?
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneAbilityMorpherIsNullMessage: The morpher gene is not active.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MorpherGizmoLimitTip: - Morpher forms: {0}/{1}\n - Morph only once: {2}\n - Possible xenotypes: {3}
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_HasOneTimeMorpherGene: One time morphers cannot change the trigger gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneMorpherCannotMorphNow: Morph is not possible at the moment.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneSpawner_CustomButtonDesc: Allows to select a product for the spawner gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneSpawner_CustomButtonProductC: The product {0} spawned has been changed to {1}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneDuplicationLetter: {CASTER_nameDef} pulsed with energy and generated a flash of light. {PAWN_nameDef} found {PAWN_objective}self face to face with a copy of {PAWN_objective}self! The duplicate claims to be the real {PAWN_nameDef} and has joined your colony.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneHostileDuplicateLetter: {CASTER_nameDef} pulsed with energy and generated a flash of light. {PAWN_nameDef} found {PAWN_objective}self face to face with a copy of {PAWN_objective}self. The duplicate is approaching {PAWN_nameDef} with murderous intent!
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneBackstoryDuplicateLetter: However, it seems {PAWN_nameDef}'s memories of the past have significant discrepancies compared to {PAWN_possessive} original.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneTraitsDuplicateLetter: However, it seems {PAWN_possessive} personality is somewhat different from the original.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneInhumanDuplicateLetter: {CASTER_nameDef} pulsed with energy and generated a flash of light. {PAWN_nameDef} found {PAWN_objective}self face to face with a copy of {PAWN_objective}self. The duplicate is completely out of {PAWN_possessive} mind, mumbling some incomprehensible nonsense and not responding to attempts to talk to {PAWN_objective}. Something has broken deep inside {PAWN_objective}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GeneDuplicatorMutationLetter: But something went wrong and {PAWN_nameDef} developed a mutation!
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MentalBreakReason_VoidVoice: {PAWN_nameDef}'s words struck a chord with {TARGET_nameDef}'s soul, and the void filled {TARGET_possessive} thoughts.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_MentalBreakReason_Inhumanized: This happened because of a genetic predisposition to psychic void patterns.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_LetterDuplicatorMentalBreak: {0} has suffered from the burden of responsibility and unbearable hardships, {PAWN_pronoun} is sure that the duplicate will share this burden with {PAWN_objective}.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RemoteControlBasicDesc: This gene responds to the neural activity of the carrier and can change in relation to current desires.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_HideShowDesc: Allows to hide or show the gizmo for the corresponding gene.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_SelfOverrideDesc: Allows to override the gene at any time.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_GenesSettingsDesc: Allows to control genes. For example, change the color of the holoeyes, turn on or off auto feed for the bloodeater, switch the wing mode, mechs summon, etc. If the gene allows to change some internal settings, then it is most likely in this list.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RemoteControlBloodeaterDesc: If off, then pawn with the bloodEATer gene will not automatically bite colonists.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RemoteControlChargerDesc: If on, the pawn will try to use charger instead of food whenever possible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RemoteControlHemogenRechargeDesc: If enabled, the pawn will try to use a recharger instead of hemogen packs whenever possible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RemoteControlGeneMakerDesc: If on, genemaker will slowly generate genepacks.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RemoteControlDustogenicDesc: If on, the pawn will prefer dustogenic food and will take it whenever possible.
LanguageData.WVC_XaG_RemoteControlMechsSummonAbilityD: After activating the ability, summons several mechanoids that will automatically attach to the mechanitor.
